bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Robert P. Cooke, October 1, 1940

div1.p: Hench has received Cooke's manuscript and will send him his own for comments.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Robert P. Cooke, October 1, 1940
div1.opener:
Picture of Lazear Memorial Bldg. sent
October 1, 1940
Dr. R. P. Cooke
State Department of Health
Lexington-Rockbridge Health Department
Lexington, Virginia
My dear Doctor Cooke:
div1.p:
I have been so busy trying to finish a medical paper that I have not been
able to acknowledge your most interesting short manuscript. I had meant to write you,
asking further questions at the time of my acknowledgement, but I will have to defer
this for a short while.

In the meantime, permit me to thank you greadly for the manuscript. In
two or three weeks, I hope to send you a copy of my long manuscript, and at that time
will take the liberty of asking you a number of questions.

I understand that you may be attending a dinner at the University of Virginia
about the twenty-third of October, at which time Moran will be there. I am delighted
to know this and wish indeed I could accept Dean Jordan's invitation to be present,
but I am afraid I cannot. At this dinner, I believe you may meet my brother, Dr.
A. L. Hench, Professor of English Literature at the University of Virginia. I sincerely
hope you will introduce yourself to him, and I hope to have the opportunity of visit-
ing you the next time I come to Virginia. I have had some very interesting in-
formation from General Kean and Generak Truby, and will ask for your comments thereon
a month or so from now.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
